qas.question: What may be presented to Parliament in various ways?
Who may introduce new laws or amendments to laws already on the books as a bill?
An MSP may introduce a bill as what?
Who may also submit private bills to Parliament?
How do bills pass through Parliament?
Presidents in the governing party introduce what laws?
A committee of the President can present what?
A member of what parliament can introduce a bill as a public member?

plausible_answers.text: a member of the Scottish Parliament

qas.question: Who can introduce a bill as a public member?

context: <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2>Bills<a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/> can be introduced to Parliament in a number of ways; <a1_0><a1_2>the <a1_1>Scottish Government<a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/> can introduce new laws or amendments to existing laws as a bill; a committee of the Parliament can present a <b6_0>bill<b6_0/> in one of the areas under its remit; <b8_0>a member of the <b7_0>Scottish<b7_0/> Parliament<b8_0/> can introduce a bill as <a2_0><a2_1>a <a2_2>private member<a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/>; or a private bill can be submitted to Parliament by <a3_0><a3_1><a3_2>an outside proposer<a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/>. Most <b5_0>draft<b5_0/> laws are government bills introduced by ministers in the governing party. Bills pass through Parliament <a4_0><a4_2>in <a4_1>a number of stages<a4_2/><a4_1/><a4_0/>:
